name: CreateGitTag
description:
Create a Git tag object on GitHub.

Use this tool to create a Git tag object on GitHub. Note that this does not automatically create the reference to make a tag in the repository; an additional call is required to create the reference. The response includes a verification object with details on the commit's signature verification, providing insights into if and why a signature was verified, or any issues that occurred.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the repository. This value is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: tag_message
parameters.description: The message or description for the tag, providing context or details about it.

parameters.name: git_object_sha
parameters.description: The SHA of the Git object to tag, typically a commit, tree, or blob.

value_schema.description: The SHA of the git object this is tagging.

parameters.name: tag_name
parameters.description: The name of the tag, typically a version (e.g., 'v0.0.1').

value_schema.description: The tag's name. This is typically a version (e.g., "v0.0.1").

parameters.name: tag_object_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of the object being tagged. Acceptable values are 'commit', 'tree', or 'blob'.

value_schema.description: The type of the object we're tagging. Normally this is a `commit` but it can also be a `tree` or a `blob`.

parameters.name: tagging_date
parameters.description: The date and time when the object was tagged, in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

value_schema.description: When this object was tagged. This is a timestamp in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

parameters.name: tagger_email
parameters.description: The email address of the tag author. This should be in a valid email format.

value_schema.description: The email of the author of the tag

parameters.name: author_of_tag_name
parameters.description: The name of the author of the tag. It should be a string providing the full name.

value_schema.description: The name of the author of the tag

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.
